column4: hello, i guess ubuntu choose a wrong soundcard driver for me. where can i change it?
How did you find out it uses the wrong driver? That shouldn't happen usually... :o
thank you for replying. I am using laptop and i check some wiki and see the suggested driver is AC97 but the one in used is ICH6
sound is working, that's weird, because the music or whatever, even the login sound, is not nice. and i can't find soundcard information from lspci or dmesg
I highly doubt it's a wrong driver problem (Ubuntu loads drivers using the unique card IDs), rather a config problem...
oh. so why can't i see my soundcard in lspci , and what can i do now?
Well, you could describe what's wrong with the sound....
I don't know why you can't see it in lspci... I can. :)
oh i am sorry, i find it now. well the sound is kind of smother, if i use this word right.
Well, don't really know about that... but it really sounds like a config problem. Maybe ask the forums, or wait if somebody here knows.
oh so there is config for sound right?
There is a config for almost anything...
oh yeah... so may i have a clue about the config part?.. i was searching for the problem blindly..
Well there's the esd config... alsa config... and so on. No idea what exactly you want, because I have no idea what's the problem.
i see. this problem just can't be described but i cannot enjoy music either.. thank you very much.
